title: Montgomery County police officer fatally shot in downtown Silver Spring
text:
Montgomery County Police are investigating who fatally shot a police officer Monday morning at a parking garage in downtown Silver Spring.

Council member Evan Glass confirmed the identity of the officer who died as T.J. Bomba.

“My heart goes out to the family of @mcpnews officer TJ Bomba, who was shot and killed in downtown Silver Spring this morning while serving our community. Keeping his fellow officers and loved ones in my thoughts,” Mr. Glass tweeted.

Police will be holding a press conference, which will be livestreamed on Facebook at 2:30 p.m.

Bomba reported disorderly conduct over the radio at a parking garage at Ellsworth Drive and Fenton Street at about 8:45 a.m. When other officers arrived on the scene for backup, they found the first officer had been shot, police said.

Police flooded the area to investigate and are looking for at least one suspect.

Streets near the area, including portions of the Capital Beltway, are temporarily shut down, and police are directing traffic.

East Silver Spring Elementary, Sligo Elementary School and Silver Spring International Middle School are all in “shelter in place” mode, which means everyone is brought in from outside, all the exterior doors are locked, and teaching continues, according to Montgomery County Public School public information office.

Peter Piringer, a spokesman for Montgomery County Fire Department and EMS, tweeted that a trauma patient was transported via a medevac helicopter from the area of the shooting to Washington Medstar Hospital.

Montgomery County Police Capt. Tom Jordan, would not comment on the officer’s identity or years of service, if he was wearing a body camera, or if he returned fire; but he added, “Everybody should be vigilant right now.”

Council member Craig Rice tweeted his condolences.

“Saddened to hear about one of our own @mcpnews Montgomery County Police officers shot and killed in downtown Silver Spring this morning. Sending thoughts and prayers to the officer and their family and friends as well as their police brothers and sisters.”

• This article is based in part on wire service reports.
